casebody.data:
William A. GATES, Jr., Plaintiff-Appellant, v. The CONTINENTAL INSURANCE COMPANY (Fidelity-Phenix Insurance Company), Defendant-Appellee. No. 29176

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Aug. 20, 1970. Rehearing Denied Sept. 11, 1970. A. Deutsche O’Neal, Philip E. Henderson, O’Neal, Waitz & Henderson, Houma, La., for plaintiff-appellant. W. K. Christovich, Christovich & Kearney, New Orleans, La., for defendant-appellee. Malcolm B. Robinson, Jr., New Orleans, La., for intervenor.

Before THORNBERRY, COLEMAN and CLARK, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5th Cir.; See Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Co. of New York et al., 5th Cir., 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

Affirmed. See Local Rule 21.1

. See NLRB v. Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, 430 F.2d 966 (5th Cir. 1970).
